New Records: West Indies won by 9 wickets with 17 balls remaining
Key Match Events: England slumped to 49 for 7 before mounting a recovery
Brandon King hit an unbeaten half-century for West Indies
Sheldon Cottrell executed a march-and-salute celebration after Jason Roy was bowled
Tom Banton edged Jason Holder to slip for a fine low catch
Pre-Game Insights: England's captain Eoin Morgan complained that his side faced 'the opposite conditions' to their warm-up fixture
Liam Dawson said that England would 'have to come back tomorrow with a fresh gameplan'
Post-Match Reflections: West Indies captain Kieron Pollard said 'Tough times donâ€™t last, tough people do'
England's players were left to ponder their batting collapse
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Kensington Oval in Barbados
